decks.notes: The deck focuses on playing aggressively using powerful Simic creatures like Questing Beast and Hydroid Krasis, supported by mana ramp from cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid. Nissa and Oko offer additional power and versatility, while Brazen Borrower provides disruption. Mass Manipulation can swing the game in your favor by stealing your opponent's creatures. The deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a mix of efficient threats and powerful planeswalkers.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cheap creatures like Fervent Champion and Scorch Spitter alongside powerful cards like Runaway Steam-Kin and Torbran, Thane of Red Fell, the deck aims to deal fast and consistent damage to the opponent. Cards like Chandra, Fire Artisan and Light Up the Stage provide card advantage and additional damage output, while Slaying Fire and Shock offer direct removal options. The goal is to maintain pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to establish board control and out-value the opponent by utilizing cards that allow for ramping, card draw, and removal. By consistently hitting land drops and ramping into powerful threats such as Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats while maintaining control of the game. Teferi, Time Raveler also provides disruption and protection for the deck's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to grind out the opponent through efficient resource management and powerful late-game threats.

The main idea of this Simic Aggro deck is to quickly set up a board presence with mana acceleration from cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid, followed by powerful threats like Questing Beast and Hydroid Krasis. Cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Nissa, Who Shakes the World provide additional utility and can help to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Disdainful Stroke helps to protect against opposing big threats, while Once Upon a Time helps to find the key pieces of the deck. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and powerful synergies.

The deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays utilizing adventure mechanics to generate card advantage and board control. By playing a mix of creatures and instant/sorcery spells, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game while also disrupting their game plan. With a versatile mix of powerful creatures and removal spells, the deck is designed to maintain tempo and apply relentless pressure to overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes powerful planeswalkers to provide additional threats and card advantage to further solidify its aggressive game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly play aggressive creatures and utilize powerful combat tricks to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. By combining Gruul creatures with cards like Embercleave and Collision / Colossus, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of high-powered attackers and direct damage spells. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive curve of the deck, allowing for consistent plays of creatures and spells to apply pressure and secure victories.

The main focus of this deck is to control the tempo of the game while utilizing the powerful ramp and card advantage of Wilderness Reclamation. By countering and removing threats with cards like Disdainful Stroke and Bonecrusher Giant, the deck aims to buy time until it can cast powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion and Escape to the Wilds to pull ahead. With strong control elements and the ability to generate large amounts of mana, the deck can outvalue opponents and secure victory through a combination of card advantage and efficient spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through countering spells, removal, and card advantage, while utilizing Wilderness Reclamation to generate additional mana and enable powerful plays. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, and ultimately win through card advantage and efficient control spells. Additionally, the inclusion of Expansion / Explosion and Irencrag Pyromancer provide the deck with the ability to finish the game with a burst of damage or card advantage when necessary.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures, utilizing the Adventure mechanic to maintain card advantage. The deck includes a mix of powerful creatures like Questing Beast and Lovestruck Beast, along with removal spells like Murderous Rider and Legion's End to control the board. Nissa, Who Shakes the World provides ramp and powerful late-game threats, while Vivien, Arkbow Ranger and Rankle, Master of Pranks offer additional value and disruption. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain momentum throughout the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Adventure mechanic to maintain card advantage and apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Questing Beast. Additionally, disruption is provided through cards like Legion's End and Rankle, Master of Pranks. The goal is to establish a fast board presence and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The deck also includes some removal options like Murderous Rider and Find / Finality to deal with opposing threats. Overall, it aims to maintain a proactive game plan and stay ahead in the tempo game.

The deck aims to control the game by using the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast spells without paying their mana cost. It ramps up with cards like Growth Spiral and Circuitous Route to get to powerful late-game threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Agent of Treachery. The deck also includes a strong toolbox of cards to search for with Fae of Wishes, allowing for flexibility in different situations. The win condition is often Field of the Dead, generating an army of zombie tokens to overwhelm the opponent.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. By utilizing cards like Bonecrusher Giant, Gruul Spellbreaker, Questing Beast, and Skarrgan Hellkite, the goal is to quickly reduce the opponent's life total while maintaining board presence. Domri, Anarch of Bolas provides additional creature support and card advantage, while Embercleave serves as a potent finisher. With efficient mana fixing from Fabled Passage and Once Upon a Time, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and end the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent through aggressive creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Murderous Rider while generating advantage with cards like Midnight Reaper and Revenge of Ravens. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing control elements such as Rankle, Master of Pranks and Priest of Forgotten Gods. The combination of sacrificing creatures with Witch's Oven and Cauldron Familiar helps to drain the opponent's life total and gain incremental advantages. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive threats and disruptive tactics.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid, allowing for early drops like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. It also includes efficient threats like Questing Beast and Hydroid Krasis, along with protection and versatility with cards like Shifting Ceratops and Voracious Hydra. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of powerful creatures and planeswalkers, while maintaining a strong board presence and constant pressure.

The main focus of this Temur Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. With a mix of powerful planeswalkers like Sarkhan the Masterless, aggressive creatures like Questing Beast and Wicked Wolf, and efficient removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant, the deck aims to control the battlefield and deal damage efficiently. The mana base is optimized for consistency to ensure that the deck can curve out smoothly and apply pressure from the early turns onwards.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers and creatures to put constant pressure on the opponent, quickly reducing their life total. By ramping with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Gilded Goose, the deck aims to play threats like Questing Beast and Wicked Wolf ahead of curve. The inclusion of Sarkhan the Masterless and Oko, Thief of Crowns provides additional versatility and control options. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for smooth gameplay, ultimately leading to fast-paced, aggressive victories.
